item.title: Everything We Know About Playboi Carti Fortnite Skin
item.content:encoded:
Nothing is off the table for Fortnite anymore, so when it’s rumored that a Playboi Carti Fortnite skin could be added to the in-game store, it’s believable. Here’s the latest on the Playboi Carti Fortnite Skin leak, if it’s true, and more.

Another small-fry name has been outed for Fortnite: A small-time rapper with nearly 50 million followers on Spotify, number one albums, and a bunch of other successes. Obvious banter aside, Playboi Carti has established themself as one of the most prominent and mainstream rap artists on the planet.

What could be bigger than Playboi Carti? Why, a collaboration between Fortnite and Playboi Carti. Let’s see if it’s true.

Is Playboi Carti Coming To Fortnite?

Multiple leaks indicated that Playboi Carti was indeed on the way to Fortnite with at least one skin as part of a unique crossover, and then the rapper themself seemed to confirm the collab on Instagram.

Usual leaker Shiina was one of many to suggest a Playboi Carti skin was coming at the very least. The official Playboi Carti Instagram posted a very interesting image to the rapper’s story to bolster the claim.

It’s a very simple and obvious clue: A giant Fortnite logo.

Unless this is either a giant coincidence or evil trolling, it’s safe to assume that Playboi Carti is coming to the live-service shooter in one form or another.

Which Playboi Carti Content Will Be Included In Fortnite?

The Playboi Carti content isn’t official, but leaks indicate that the game is receiving at least one Playboi Carti skin, and perhaps even a special in-game event to go with it.

Happy Power thinks a skin is a guarantee, and says the content: “Will feature the ‘Evil Jordan’ outfit as well.

The attire in question relates to Playboi Carti’s song Evil Jordan, where the singer has a Batman/demon-esuqe head garment, with a red bandana and other eye-catching qualities.

Kurrco has gone one better and claimed an ‘In-game event’ is also planned.

Until anything is official, take any information with a pinch of salt. But it would be another in the never-ending conveyor belt of crossovers and special skins if it happens.

Where would a Playboi Carti bundle or special items rank on your wanted list? Is Epic and Fortnite’s pulling power officially unlimited? Share your thoughts on the rumored crossover and future Fortnite content in general over at the Insider Gaming Discord Server.

Speaking of Fortnite content, check out Epic Adding Animated Favorites as Sidekicks, and Fortnite Getting A Back to the Future Collaboration For Chapter 7.

item.title: Steam Machine—Everything To Know About Valve’s New System
item.content:encoded:
After months of rumor and speculation, Valve revealed its new Steam Machine console in November 2025, to the surprise of many. The announcement wasn’t advertised and, aside from some insiders, wasn’t expected. But then it happened, a new Steam Machine revealed nearly 10 years to the day of the release of Valve’s first attempt at the living room console space.

Valve’s newest piece of hardware—aside from the Steam Controller and Steam Frame VR Headset—is aiming to bring PC gaming to the living

Ahead of its release in 2026, there’s plenty to learn about the Steam Machine. That’s why Insider Gaming has put together a one-stop shop of information with everything you need to know about the Steam Machine. This page will be updated regularly as any news breaks, so bookmark it and check back often for the latest.

Everything We Know About The Steam Machine

The Steam Machine was announced on November 12, 2025, as part of a major announcement of the latest Valve hardware. In addition to the affectionately named “Gabecube”, Valve revealed the Steam Frame VR Headset and its second Steam Controller.

Steam Machine Release Date

When the console was announced in November, Valve said that the Steam Machine would release in early 2026. As of writing, Valve still hasn’t confirmed an official release date. If you want to narrow down a window, it’s expected to launch by April 2026.

More details on a release date are expected to come after the start of the new year. That’s also when you’ll be able to find out where you can buy a Steam Machine for yourself.

How Much Will The Steam Machine Cost?

Like the release date, Valve has yet to reveal the price of the Steam Machine. What’s happened since the announcement, though, has been plenty of speculation.

Many fans believed that it would be priced like a traditional video game console. However, Valve has confirmed that it will, instead, be priced as PC because, as you’ll see later on, it is a fully functional computer.

When it releases, there will be two Steam Machine models to choose from: 512GB and 2TB. There will also be an option to buy a bundle that includes the Steam Controller.

That means a variety of prices will be available. There will be one price for the 512GB version of the Steam Machine and a different, more expensive price, for the 2TB. There will also be separate prices for the bundles with the new Steam Controller.

What Are The Steam Machine Specs?

When the Steam Machine was announced, the first thing everyone wanted to know was how powerful will it be. Based on the confirmed specs, it is being targeted to compare to most entry level gaming PCs.

Valve says that the system can support 4K 60FPS gaming when using AMD FSR. If you are just looking for 1080P gaming, you should have no problem reaching those numbers on higher settings.

The Steam Machine will feature an Arch-based SteamOS 3 but can support other operating systems if desired. It includes 16GB DDR5 RAM, an internal power supply, Wi-Fi 6E and Bluetooth 5.3. Where some might be disappointed is the fact that it’s video outputs are DisplayPort 1.4 and HDMI 2.0. The older technology could limit quality in the coming years as opposed to just including HDMI 2.1 and DisplayPort 2.0 or 2.1.

You can check out full details on what’s inside the Steam Machine below.

Steam Machine General Features

The Steam Machine is a uniquely designed system that looks like nothing Valve has ever released. As mentioned, it’s a PC in a box that’s designed to make it easier to quickly play your PC games on your TV.

Size wise, it’s just under 6″ tall, about 6.3″ deep, and just over 6″ wide. Its small size should allow it to fit discretely in more entertainment centers. There is a large fan on the back aimed at keeping the internal power supply and other components cool at all times, and that’s kind of what the box is designed around.

On the back there are two USB-A 2.0 ports and a USB-C 3.2 Gen 3 port to go along with video outputs, ethernet, and power connector. The front of the box includes two USB-A 3.2 ports, a microSD slot, power button, and indicator LED. There are also two features on the front to give the Steam Machine a unique look.

First, the system allows swappable faceplates similar to the Xbox 360. The plate is magnetic for easy removal, and there’s sure to be a number of third-party designs available when the system releases. For those who want to make their own, Valve is planning on making 3D files available as well.

Under the faceplate is a customizable LED strip that will let you change colors and animations for things like download progress, console updates, errors, and more.

item.title: Ghost of Yotei Update 1.100 Patch Notes—New Game Plus, Cosmetics, Bug Fixes
item.content:encoded:
The newest update for Ghost of Yotei, Version 1.100, as well as patch notes, are available now. With it, New Game Plus has been added, alongside new cosmetics and various bug fixes.

Released in October, Ghost of Yotei serves as a spiritual sequel to 2020’s Ghost of Tsushima. Following mercenary Atsu, she travels across Edo to exact revenge on those who killed her family. The PlayStation 5 exclusive is one of 2025’s best-reviewed titles alongside Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 and Death Stranding 2: On The Beach. While it isn’t nominated for Game of the Year at The Game Awards, it did snag some huge nominations like Best Music and Best Performance. Earlier this month, Sucker Punch teased Patch 1.100, which would add many new elements. Now, we have a detailed look thanks to the patch notes.

The 1.100 update for Ghost of Yotei isn’t too long, patch notes-wise. However, it finally adds a highly requested mode: New Game Plus. Now, if you completed the game and want more, you can return to the beginning of the story with all your previously unlocked upgrades. Furthermore, new outfits, Photo Mode additions, and fixes to gameplay and UI/UX have been included.

Ghost of Yotei 1.100 Full Patch Notes

The full patch notes for Update 1.100 for Ghost of Yotei are available below. To see it in action, check out the video above and available here.

New Game Plus

  • Added ability to replay challenge content after completing them once.
    • All 22 Yotei Six Camps.
    • 26 Replayable Duels.
  • Added a New Game Plus Vendor.
    • Ghost Flowers will be rewarded across the game to be used as currency for the vendor.
  • Various new cosmetic items and charms.
  • Two new armor sets.
  • Two new trophies.
  • New Photo Mode features.
  • VRR support.
  • Added a new “Balanced” graphic mode.
    • Requires a display that supports a refresh rate of 120Hz.
  • Added option to remap touchpad swipe functions to the right directional button on the D-pad.
  • New option to display a visual indicator when being led by animals.
  • The player now has the ability to turn off fall damage.
    • Some falls will still be lethal.
  • Added option to automatically loot dead enemies.
  • Added option to allow for skipping Sumi-e minigames.
  • Added an additional load-out slot.
  • Added new alternative controls for mini-games. 

Performance and Stability

  • Various rare crash fixes.
  • Various fixes to rare visual bugs.

Gameplay

  • Various bug fixes across several missions and mission blocker fixes.
  • Bug fixes and minor adjustments to the autosave feature.
  • A few adjustments to charm description text to better describe charm perks.

UI/UX

  • Minor photo mode fixes and additional icons.

What do you think of Ghost of Yotei Update 1.100’s patch notes? Excited to play New Game Plus? Where does it rank on your Best of 2025 list? Let us know in the comments and on the official Insider Gaming Discord!

item.title: Best Cheap Gaming Gifts Under $25 For Holiday 2025
item.content:encoded:
Finding a good gift for the gamer in your life when you’re working with a tight budget can feel tougher than it probably should. After all, prices keep going up and money feels tighter for many. But not every present needs to cost you a fortune. That’s why Insider Gaming has put together a list of genuinely fun, useful gifts that still feel thoughtful and worth unwrapping. The best part, these gaming gifts are all on the cheap side at less than $25.

Whether you’re shopping for a friend, a family member, or just treating yourself, these picks prove you don’t need to overspend to give something great. When it comes to gifting, sometimes the smaller items end up being the ones people appreciate the most. A clever phone stand, a handy charging dock, or even a retro-themed game or controller can upgrade someone’s setup without hitting your wallet hard. And for those who love gaming culture as much as playing the games, books, card games, and novelty items can be just as meaningful as any big-ticket tech.

Below, you’ll find a mix gifts that stay under that $25 ceiling, making it easier to stick to a budget while still giving something they’ll actually use. Let’s take a look at the best cheap gaming gifts for 2025.

Best Gaming Gifts Under $25

1985 Games Mystery Dice

Want to get a new set of dice for your Dungeons & Dragons campaigns or other table-top nights? This mystery dice set takes the decision of what dice to use out of your hand and gives you a random set of seven. This adds a little extra excitement before your next game night.

FYOUNG Nintendo Switch/Switch 2 Controller Charging Dock

Charging wireless controllers can be frustrating, especially if you forget to plug them in after use. For those with the Nintendo Switch, you can only charge the ones on your console usually, leaving your extras without the juice. This charging dock keeps up to four Joy-Cons charged and works with both Switch 1 and Switch 2 controllers.

AZURAOKEY Carrying Case

The ASUS ROG Xbox Ally and Ally X are expensive pieces of equipment. So, why not protect the investment with a carrying cat that also comes with compartments for your chargers, memory cards, and other small accessories?

SOUNDANCE Laptop Stand

Not much you can say about a laptop stand. It opens up room on your desk while bringing the display up higher for your eyes. The stand supports laptops ranging from 12-17.3 inches.

Press Reset by Jason Schrier

From Jason Schreier himself:

“The business of videogames is both a prestige industry and an opaque one. Based on dozens of first-hand interviews that cover the development of landmark games—Bioshock Infinite, Epic Mickey, Dead Space, and more—on to the shocking closures of the studios that made them, Press Reset tells the stories of how real people are affected by game studio shutdowns, and how they recover, move on, or escape the industry entirely.”

8Bitdo M30 Bluetooth Controller

Want a cheap way to play classic Sega Games, or any game for that matter? This M30 Bluetooth Controller is designed to mimic the classic six-button Sega Genesis controller. It works on your Nintendo Switch or Switch 2, Windows PCs, and even mobile devices.

8BitDo Wireless USB Adapter 2

Want to guarantee you can hook up any Bluetooth controller to any device? This wireless USB adapter allows you connect your controllers to your Switch 2, Switch, PC, Steam Deck, and more.

8Bitdo Bluetooth Retro Receiver 

If the person you’re buying for still likes to play on their PlayStation (PS1) or PlayStation 2 (PS2), why not give them the gift of wireless control. The 8Bitdo Bluetooth Retro Receiver allows you to use your Xbox, PS4, PS5, Wii U Pro and Switch Pro controllers wirelessly with the PS1 or PS2. Imagine just sitting on your couch that’s more than 10 feet from your TV?

UNO: The Legend of Zelda Card Game 

UNO? Great game. The Legend of Zelda? Great franchise. So, why not combine them with a special version of UNO that features the artwork of The Legend of Zelda. There’s even a special Triforce Card that forces the next player to draw an addition three cards. Get it? Triforce? Three Cards?

JSAUX Docking Station

The Ally X, Steam Deck, Legion Go, and other handheld gaming PCs are all great devices, but sometimes you don’t want to play on the small screen. This docking station—which is actively in use by Senior Editor Mike Straw—allows you to not only hook your handheld to a larger display with HDMI 2.1, but also connect two USB-A devices, an ethernet cable, and a 100W USB-C charging port for your handheld to stay powered during use.

Banjo-Kazooie Mobile Phone & Controller Holder

An 8.5″ figure made from PVC, this Banjo-Kazooie holder is the perfect place to set your phone, controller, or other small devices when not in use.

The Oregon Trail Card Game

If you have a millennial you’re shopping for, why not give them the gift of dysentery and let them relive their youth. Supporting 2-6 players with 8-bit art, The Oregon Trail Card Game has you try to stay alive from Independence, Missouri to the Willamette Valley.

Are there any gaming gifts on the cheaper side that you are looking to pick up for the 2025 holiday season? Leave your picks down in the comments and join us over at the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

item.title: Xbox Reveals New Special Edition Crocs
item.content:encoded:
Your shoes are now an Xbox. A new collaboration between Xbox and footwear brand Crocs has been announced, and it’s one for the 2000s kids.

With the 20th anniversary of the Xbox 360, Microsoft has been a bit quiet in terms of celebration. Over the weekend, many outlets, like Insider Gaming, did lists on the console, like the staff’s favorite titles and best-selling. However, it seems the company has had one foot in the door the whole time. Luckily, that foot looks rather stylish with the new designs in its collaboration with Crocs.

Xbox Crocs Available November 25th, Cost $80

Announced today, Crocs and Xbox are collaborating on a special edition pair of Crocs shoes. The pair will don the Xbox logo and made to look like an Xbox controller, complete with buttons and joysticks. So, basically, your feet can look like controllers. Who doesn’t want that? The collaboration is starting sales on November 25th and will cost $80. If the controller Crocs are too expensive, you can get limited-edition Xbox Jibbitz, which include designs from Fallout, Halo, and League of Legends, to name a few. Those cost around $20 and also launch on November 25th. You can find the link for purchasing here.

In the world of collaborations, it’s not a surprise to see Xbox going outside of the box. A while ago, Xbox made an Xbox Series X Mini Fridge, as the console looked like one. While not connected much, the statement ‘This is an Xbox’ does feel apt for this. The company’s desire to be just about everywhere is certainly working, with exclusives like Halo going to PlayStation and future titles going multiplatform. Soon, you won’t be able to outrun an Xbox; you’ll just wear them on your feet.

What do you think of the Xbox Crocs? Going to get a pair? Just buying the Jibbitz? Any other out-there collaborations Microsoft should do? Let us know in the comments and on the official Insider Gaming Discord!

item.title: Black Ops 7 Multiplayer Receives 8 New Modes in Season 1
item.content:encoded:
Call of Duty fans are getting an early treat in Black Ops 7 Multiplayer with Season 1, as eight new modes are coming to the game—six of which will remain permanently available.

Season 1 in Black Ops 7, kicking off on December 4, brings a host of new additions to the title, including a variety of maps and new maps for Zombies, and players in Multiplayer will be spoiled for choice on the game modes to enjoy.

Black Ops 7 Gets 6 New Modes, 2 LTMs

As revealed in the Call of Duty blog, Black Ops 7 will see the addition of eight new Multiplayer modes, two of which are limited-time only and will form a part of the CODMAS event.

The permanent game modes being added include Prop Hunt, Gun Game, One in the Chamber, and Sticks and Stones, along with a new mode, Takeover, where players fight over three neutral territories and earn points for each zone they control. Once all three zones are captured, a short cooldown takes place before they move to new locations—effectively making it a mix of Domination and Headquarters.

During the season, two limited-time modes are coming as part of CODMAS festivities. Holiday Havoc is a “festive moshpit combiting your favourite modes with holiday cheer,” where players can earn bonuses like Quick Regen, Spring Speed, and Movement Speed for eliminating enemies.

Snowfight is the other LTM featuring in-season, which, as the name suggests, sees players throw snowballs at each other to eliminate them, with no respawns.

Season 1 in Multiplayer also brings additional loadout content in the form of the Deadeye Drone, available as a Weekly Challenge Reward during the season for completing weekly objectives.

Which of the game modes coming to Black Ops 7 are you most excited for? Share your thoughts with other players in the Insider Gaming Discord.

For more Black Ops 7, read about the record low of sales in Japan, and check out all of the Dark Ops Challenges in Zombies.
